image.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Who is David Sacks? Elon Musk’s former PayPal ally turned AI & Crypto Czar in Trump’s administration
item.description: Donald Trump appointed David Sacks, former PayPal executive and venture capitalist, as the White House AI and Crypto Czar. Sacks, a member of the "PayPal Mafia," will guide policy on artificial intelligence and cryptocurrency. He's a prominent tech figure and co-host of the All-In Podcast. A vocal proponent of cryptocurrency, Sacks has described the rise of Bitcoin as a revolutionary moment for the internet. Interestingly, Sacks was involved in ousting Elon Musk, now also appointed by Trump, from PayPal over two decades ago.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Former Chilean president Michelle Bachelet to receive 2024 Indira Gandhi Peace Prize
item.description: Former Chilean president Michelle Bachelet has been awarded the 2024 Indira Gandhi Prize for Peace, Disarmament and Development. The award recognizes her global advocacy for human rights, gender equality, and the rights of vulnerable populations. Bachelet's career includes leading UN Women, serving as UN High Commissioner for Human Rights, and implementing significant reforms during her two presidential terms.
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk

item.title: 'Kinda hot': How UnitedHealthcare CEO's assassin became America's new 'thirst trap'
item.description: Amid the serious discussions, a surprising and surreal narrative emerged: the alleged killer’s unexpected rise as a “thirst trap.” Surveillance images released by law enforcement showed a suspect with striking features, sparking comparisons to actors like Timothée Chalamet and Josh O’Connor—icons of the so-called “Rodent Man” aesthetic. Social media users began commenting on the suspect’s angular jawline, prominent cheekbones, and brooding demeanour, turning him into an unlikely object of online fascination.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: What will happen next in South Korea if President Yoon is removed?
item.description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol faces mounting calls for impeachment after declaring martial law and accusing the opposition of supporting North Korea. His own party leader backs impeachment, and the military refuses to enforce further martial law orders. The opposition needs a few more votes to suspend Yoon, with the prime minister set to take over if successful.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: DOGE leaders Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy react to 'absurd' federal remote work practices
item.description: A new report reveals that a mere 6% of federal employees work on-site full-time, while nearly one-third are fully remote. Critics, including Elon Musk, question government efficiency, with Musk asserting that barely 1% of federal workers, excluding security and maintenance, work a full 40-hour week in person.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Royal fans spot unusual in JFK's grandson Jack Schlossberg's Instagram story. What is it?
item.description: Royal watchers were surprised to spot a photo of Prince William and Princess Kate in Jack Schlossberg's Instagram story. Schlossberg, grandson of JFK, praised Prince William's Earthshot Prize, an initiative inspired by JFK's moonshot speech. He also recently criticized an auction of his aunt's belongings.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: The Doll: Meet Karen Julieth Ojeda Rodriguez, a Colombian hitwoman who killed her ex-boyfriend in cold blood
item.description: But "The Doll" didn’t operate alone. Alongside her arrest, police detained Paula Valentina Joya Rueda, ominously nicknamed "Gorda Sicaria" (Fat Hitwoman), and a third accomplice known as “Leopoldo.” With them, officers seized a cache of weapons, including a revolver and a 9mm pistol, possibly linked to the murders that had terrorized the region.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Bonnie Blue? British pornstar deported from Australia for filming young men
item.description: Blue, who faced deportation from both Australia and Fiji for visa violations, told News.com.au that she stands by her actions despite being labelled “predatory” by critics. She defended her practices as consensual and highlighted the safeguards she implements to ensure ethical standards.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'I just can’t feel sympathy for him': Torrent of hate at health insurers after CEO’s murder in US
item.description: A UnitedHealthcare executive was shot dead in Manhattan. The incident triggered public anger against the US health insurance industry. Words on the bullet casings hinted at healthcare grievances. Social media exploded with discussions about denied claims and high costs. The industry now faces scrutiny over its practices and security measures.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Texas attorney burns son's body after fatally shooting him
item.description: A 68-year-old Houston attorney, Michael C. Howard, is facing murder charges after fatally shooting his 20-year-old son, Mark, who had Down syndrome. Howard claimed he mistook his son for an intruder at his East Texas property. He then burned the body on a woodpile and waited 17 hours to report the incident. Howard's bond is set at $20 million.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Want to become virgin again': Influencer to spend $19k on surgery to restore virginity, doctor warns of risks
item.description: A 23-year-old influencer will spend $19,000 on surgery to restore her virginity. The procedure, hymenoplasty, reconstructs the hymen. A doctor warns of risks like infections and scarring.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Turkey, Iran and Russia to meet in Doha on Saturday to discuss Syria, Turkish source says
item.description: Foreign ministers from Turkey, Iran, and Russia are set to convene in Doha this Saturday to address the recent surge by Syrian rebels. The rebels have achieved significant territorial gains, capturing Aleppo and Hama.

item.title: 'You're welcome': Trump after Bitcoin hits $100,000 mark
item.description: US President-elect Donald Trump on Thursday took credit for bitcoin's historic surge past $100,000, telling his social media followers "you're welcome" after the cryptocurrency jumped more than 50 percent since his election victory. Bitcoin broke $100,000 for the first time Thursday after Trump nominated cryptocurrency backer Paul Atkins to head the US securities regulator, reinforcing optimism the incoming president will deregulate the sector.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: America’s Got Talent semi-finalist Kabir Singh passes away at 39
item.description: Indian-origin comedian Kabir Singh, known for his appearance on America's Got Talent, passed away at 39. He was found dead in his sleep on Wednesday, December 5th. While authorities suspect natural causes due to prior health issues, investigations are ongoing pending toxicology reports. Funeral services are scheduled for December 14th in Hayward, California.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who was Glenn Litton? Homeless man shot two children at California school before taking his own life
item.description: Glenn Litton, a 56-year-old homeless man with a criminal history and mental health issues, opened fire at a California Seventh-Day Adventist school, critically injuring two young boys. Litton, claiming to be part of an "international alliance," left a note citing America's global involvement as justification. He then used a ghost gun to shoot the children before taking his own life.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Iran conducts successful space launch in program long criticised by West
item.description: Iran launched a satellite-carrying rocket using its Simorgh program, a move the West believes bolsters its missile technology. This launch, amidst heightened Middle East tensions, comes after the expiration of UN missile sanctions. While Iran insists on peaceful intentions, concerns remain about its nuclear capabilities and past military nuclear program.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Division is one of the greatest challenges of our time,' says Barack Obama at democracy forum
item.description: Former President Barack Obama addressed divisiveness in his first post-election speech, calling it a major challenge. He emphasized the importance of building alliances and coalitions for lasting change, even with those holding differing views. Obama acknowledged limits to compromise when fundamental justice is threatened, citing historical figures who championed pluralism. He urged collaborative action for a more just society.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: World's oldest-known wild bird lays egg in Hawaii at age 74
item.description: Wisdom, a 74-year-old Laysan albatross and the world's oldest known wild bird, has laid another egg at the Midway Atoll National Wildlife Refuge. This is believed to be her 60th egg and her first in four years. While her longtime mate Akeakamai is missing, Wisdom has been seen with a new partner.
item.dc:creator: TOI Science Desk

item.title: Elon Musk donated over $260 Million to support Donald Trump’s 2024 campaign: Report
item.description: Elon Musk donated over $261.5 million to support Donald Trump's 2024 presidential campaign, primarily through his super PAC, America PAC. He also funded groups linking Trump's abortion stance to Ruth Bader Ginsburg and encouraging Robert F. Kennedy Jr. supporters to vote for Trump. Now, Musk is part of Trump's transition team, co-leading the Department of Government Efficiency with Vivek Ramaswamy.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Canada gun ban: Additional 324 military-style firearms barred, explores donation to Ukraine amid growing tensions
item.description: Canada banned 324 additional firearm models deemed more suitable for warfare than sport or hunting, intending to donate some to Ukraine. This expands on a 2020 ban and includes an amnesty period for owners. The move, preceding the École Polytechnique tragedy's anniversary, aims to curb gun violence, but faces criticism for impacting licensed owners.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
